intro: Phyllostegia degeneri, commonly known as the narrowleaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Phyllostegia degeneri is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
